intro: Oreopanax weberbaueri, commonly known as the mountain sarsaparilla, is a shrub native to the Andean regions of South America. It belongs to the Araceae family and is characterized by its palmate leaves and distinctive, spadix-like inflorescences. The plant typically grows in humid, shaded environments at high altitudes. Its stems are often woody and can reach several meters in height. Oreopanax weberbaueri is valued for its ornamental qualities and has been used in traditional medicine in some regions.
